componentAttributes.richTextValue:
SvelteKit Pokedex


This application is the follow along code for James Q Quick's tutorial video SvelteKit Crash Course - SSR, API Routes, Stores, Tailwind CSS, and More! Having recently finished a Svelte tutorial which covered Sapper, I began investigating projects, templates, setups, etc. to start creating my own projects and soon found out that SvelteKit had come into popularity as an official replacement for Sapper. Thus, I did this tutorial to familarize myself with SvelteKit.


So although the project itself is not entirely of my own creation, I took the opportunity to explore deployment options as well for future reference. I found the most popular option to be Vercel, where even the creator of Svelte has joined their team to effectively make it the unofficial choice for hosting and deploying Svelte projects. And I must say, after figuring out the inital setup - they do make it a cinch to get your project up and out there. This tutorial also taught me about Tailwind CSS which is one of the most thorough CSS frameworks I have worked with and may become the go to preference going forward. On top of Tailwind, I found a great component library built on top of Tailwind CSS called daisyUI. Not only does it provide components, but the two packages combines also provide the ability to setup your own theme and style your website with primary and accent colors easily.


Application: https://sveltekit-pokedex-ashen.vercel.app/

API: https://sveltekit-pokedex-ashen.vercel.app/api/pokemon

Repository: https://github.com/matthewdoles/sveltekit-pokedex
